com.compilerlab.program.expressions.intExpressions

Class Sum

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.compilerlab.program.expressions.Expression

        • com.compilerlab.program.expressions.intExpressions.Sum
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Compilable

    public class Sum
extends IntExpression
    This class represents the sum-expression "'left' + 'right'".

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sum

        public Sum(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Value> localVariables,
   Expression left,
   Expression right)
        Default initialization of the sum-expression.
        Parameters:
        localVariables - The local variables hash map.
        left - The expression on the left of the plus-sign.
        right - The expression on the right of the plus-sign.

    • Method Detail

      • compile

        public java.util.List<Command> compile()
        This function returns the list of commands needed for the assembler execution.
        Returns:
        The list of commands.

      • getStackSize

        public int getStackSize()
        This function returns the stack size needed for the execution of the operation. Maximum of the stack sizes of the expression on the left, and the expression on the right increased by one (since the result of the left expression is still on the stack while evaluating the right expression).
        Returns:
        The size of the stack.

        public java.lang.String toString()
